entry.def: Shēng 生 can occasionally come to refer to something like one's daily work.
Shēng 生 (ant. miè 滅 "be extinguished (as dinosaurs)") refers to the coming into existence of something which did not previously exist. [PERFECTIVE]

sense.def: that has arisen, that has materialised; that is arising; (of moon) that begins to wax
originate; come to emerge; be naturally found in (of inanimate subjects), occur naturally in
arise from S being the case
arise; appear 生民; come to birth (with postposed subject)
be produced> arise from; arise therefrom
cause to come into existence, cause to exist
arise from V-ing (for the commoner 生於)
(nab.post-N) lifespan of the contextually determinate N
the life of the contextually determinate N

entry.def: Shēng 生 (ant. sǐ 死 "die") is a colourless general word for the fact of being delivered of offspring or for engendering offspring, and the word also has many derived and related meanings. [FACT], [+FIG], [GENERAL]; [[COMMON+]]

sense.def: birth (as part of the fours phases of birth, continuation, change, and extinction)
born, birth- (as in birth-place), rebirth- (as in rebirth-station)
from birth; at birth 生而
be born in N; be reborn in
reproduce, have offspring; give birth to things
give birth to indefinite and omitted N
give birth to the contextually determinate N
be born in N; get reborn in N
give birth to; cause to come into existence
be born at the time N
derived: begin to grow, begin to sprout
(the entirety of) what is so in a creature or thing from birth (or from its origins); what is innate in a creature;

entry.def: The current standard word for being alive is shēng 生 (ant. sǐ 死 "be dead").

sense.def: start to live, come to life, waken
life, way of life, conditions of life
one's state of being alive; one's life; one's survival; sometimes even: livelihood 治生 "look after one's livelihood"
lifespan, the stretch of time one is alive 長生
the living, those who are alive; living creatures
alive, live; living; occurring during one's lifetime
in a living state, while alive; sometimes the reference is to the object: while still alive 生燒人
be left alive; be made to survive
live in a place 生世上
cause to be a living creature; cause to survive; cause to have a good life
give rise to > begin to V

entry.def: The current general term for a plant having a place as a habitat is shēng 生

sense.def: make N grow, allow N to grow
catch alive (Han, Sima Xiangru 上林賦)

entry.def: Shēng 生 (ant. shú 熟 "cooked") refers to something that has not undergone any form of cooking and remains entirely free from treatment with heat.

sense.def: cause to grow, grow (grain); produce; give rise to; be the origin of, originate
types of production, kinds of engendering
be designed to preserve life, safe
create, cause to exist on earth
create, cause to exist on earth
living being (often clearly including humans, but frequently indistinguishable from the examples collected under ANIMAL)
master, Mr (always placed after a proper name)
rear; nourish; get to flourish; provide for
(colloquial) suffix after verbs expressing high degree or intensity (often appearing together with intensifying adverb tài 太)

entry.def: Shēng 生 simply refers to literates.
